channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap came loose, and the liquid leaked. The package was then placed into a bin. DescribePack: The package failed due to the cap becoming loose from one of the bottles and leaked into the package. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was then placed into a red hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023080159
item.description:
Report X-2023080159

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents placed in pkg with no packing material allowing the contents to move freely causing damage and release of liquid contents wetting the contents and carton. Upon discovery the unmarked pkg was placed in a unauthorized unlined plastic bin and sent to QA where it was later transferred to the Hazmat Processing Area by trained personnel. DescribePack: Missing cap on 1 x 1 plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in bin.

item.title: Report X-2023071157
item.description:
Report X-2023071157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and immediately removed from workflow. Package was placed in a plastic tote and retrieved by QA member in Unload area for inspection. DescribePack: External fiberboard container and inner plastic bladder are crushed, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023071077
item.description:
Report X-2023071077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and left on SWAK scale rollers in Unload area for QA inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Two of the caps on the one-gallon bottles were loose, permitting leakage. Package experienced compression/crushing, displacing liquid contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023071062
item.description:
Report X-2023071062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: WALLINGFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found while unloading from the trailer. Not sure when the puncture happened. There was obvious internal leakage all over the contents. It was set to the side for the haz mat trained personnel to handle it. DescribePack: One plastic bottle had a puncture that had caused almost the entire gallon to leak out. It leaked all over the other 3 bottles inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was brought to the side and turned in such a way to stop the leaking.

item.title: Report E-2023070944
item.description:
Report E-2023070944

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the lid was loose on one of the metal 55 gallon drum of nitroethane (un2842) and that 1 cup of product was released. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023070070
item.description:
Report X-2023070070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: BOZRAH
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON DURING SHIFT, RESPONDER WAS CALLED. DURING INSPECTION/REWRAP PROCESS RESPONDER NOTED THAT PACKAGE CONTAINED 16 CYCLINDERS LABELED AS BUTANE FUEL/UN 2037 WITHOUT ANY REGULATED/HAZMAT MARKINGS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK.
